item.title: The shortest and longest government shutdowns in U.S. history
item.description: The government shut down on Oct. 1. Here’s a look at the shortest and longest government shutdowns in U.S. history.

item.title: Maryland speeders to pay more, D.C. changes health care under new laws
item.description: News laws that take effect Oct. 1 include a tiered speeding ticket system in Maryland and a pay increase for police officers in Washington, D.C.
